metadata.title: CVE-2022-30594 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The Linux kernel before 5.17.2 mishandles seccomp permissions. ThePTRACE_SEIZE code path allows attackers to bypass intended restrictions onsetting the PT_SUSPEND_SECCOMP flag.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-30594` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-227-generic - 4.4.0-227.261
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-227-generic - 4.4.0-227.261
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-227-lowlatency - 4.4.0-227.261
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-180-generic - 4.15.0-180.189~16.04.1
